skill.name: visual-design-foundations
skill.description: Apply typography, color theory, spacing systems, and iconography principles to create cohesive visual designs. Use when establishing design tokens, building style guides, or improving visual hierarchy and consistency.
skill.summary: Apply typography, color theory, spacing systems, and iconography principles to create cohesive visual designs.
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: All 144 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The scanner misidentified CSS custom properties as shell commands, RegExp.exec() as Python exec(), and hex color codes as cryptographic hashes. This is documentation-only content with no executable code.

content.value_statement: Poor visual design leads to inconsistent user experiences and accessibility failures. This skill provides typography, color, spacing, and iconography foundations to build accessible, scalable visual systems.
actual_capabilities: Generate typography scales using modular ratio-based sizing
Create accessible color palettes with WCAG contrast compliance
Implement spacing systems based on 8-point grid principles
Build design token systems for CSS custom properties
Apply visual hierarchy principles to improve readability
Configure dark mode and theming support
limitations: Does not generate actual design files or mockups
Does not evaluate existing designs against brand guidelines
Does not provide real-time accessibility auditing of live websites
Does not generate icon assets or SVG files

use_cases.title: Establish Design Tokens for a New Project
use_cases.description: Generate a complete design token system including typography scales, color palettes, and spacing variables for a new application or design system.
use_cases.target_user: Frontend developers and designers starting new projects

use_cases.title: Improve Visual Hierarchy in Existing UI
use_cases.description: Analyze and restructure typography, color, and spacing to create clearer visual hierarchy and improve content readability across a user interface.

use_cases.title: Build Accessible Color Systems
use_cases.description: Create semantic color tokens with WCAG-compliant contrast ratios for text, backgrounds, and interactive states.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Design System Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a design token system for [PROJECT TYPE] with typography scale, color palette, and spacing system. Include CSS custom properties.
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new project and need foundational design variables

prompt_templates.title: Color Palette Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an accessible [THEME] color palette with semantic tokens for primary, secondary, success, warning, error, and neutral colors. Include WCAG contrast compliance.
prompt_templates.scenario: Building color tokens for a theming system

prompt_templates.title: Typography Scale Creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a modular typography scale using [RATIO] ratio. Include font sizes, line heights, and letter spacing for headings, body text, and UI labels.
prompt_templates.scenario: Setting up type tokens for consistent text styling

prompt_templates.title: Complete Design System
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a comprehensive design system for [APP TYPE] including typography, color, spacing, and iconography guidelines. Reference best practices for [FRAMEWORK] implementation.
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a full design system from scratch

output_examples.input: Create CSS design tokens for a SaaS dashboard with primary blue brand color
Design a dark mode color scheme with semantic tokens

best_practices: Use modular scales for typography to create harmonious size relationships between text elements
Establish semantic color tokens (e.g., --color-action-primary) rather than hardcoded values to enable easy theming
Apply the 8-point grid system consistently for spacing, margins, and padding to create visual rhythm
anti_patterns: Using arbitrary pixel values instead of defined spacing tokens leads to inconsistent visual rhythm
Hardcoding colors directly in component styles prevents effective theming and dark mode support
Applying multiple font families or weights unnecessarily creates visual noise and maintenance burden

faq.question: What modular scale ratio should I use?
faq.answer: Major Third (1.250) works well for most applications. Use Minor Third (1.200) for content-heavy sites and Perfect Fourth (1.333) for marketing pages with large headlines.

faq.question: How do I ensure WCAG compliance for colors?
faq.answer: Maintain minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio for normal text and 3:1 for large text. Use tools like WebAIM Contrast Checker to verify combinations before finalizing tokens.

faq.question: Should I use pixels or rem units?
faq.answer: Use rem units for typography and spacing to respect user font size preferences. Base rem value should be 16px by default.

faq.question: How many colors do I need in a palette?
faq.answer: Start with 5-9 neutral gray steps and 5-7 steps per accent color. This provides enough flexibility without overwhelming the design system.

faq.question: What is the 8-point grid system?
faq.answer: All spacing, margins, and padding values are multiples of 8px (4px, 8px, 16px, 24px, 32px). This creates consistent visual rhythm and simplifies design decisions.

faq.question: How do I structure design tokens for scalability?
faq.answer: Separate tokens into three tiers: primitive (raw values like #2563eb), semantic (meaning-based like --color-primary), and component (component-specific like --button-bg-primary).
